      • addition

        public BayesianFunctionFactor addition​(BayesianFactor factor)
        Description copied from class: BayesianAbstractFactor

        This generic implementation checks if GenericFactor.isLog() the current factor and also the given one. If both are false, then a SimpleBayesianOperation algebra will be used and a BayesianDefaultFactor will be produced; otherwise a LogBayesianOperation algebra will be used, the second factor will be converted to a BayesianLogFactor (if needed) and a BayesianLogFactor will be returned.

        The BayesianOperation.add(BayesianFactor, int, BayesianFactor, int) method will be used.

        Specified by:
        addition in interface BayesianFactor
        Overrides:
        addition in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - the other factor to combine with
        Returns:
        a BayesianLogFactor if this factor works in log-space, otherwise a BayesianDefaultFactor

      • logProb

        public double logProb​(gnu.trove.map.TIntIntMap[] data,
                      int leftVar)

      • filter

        public BayesianFunctionFactor filter​(int variable,
                                     int state)
        Description copied from class: BayesianAbstractFactor

        Reduces the domain by removing a variable and selecting the specified state.

        This default implementation uses a SimpleBayesianFilter as BayesianCollector and checks if this factor GenericFactor.isLog(): if true builds a BayesianDefaultFactor else a BayesianDefaultFactor.

        Specified by:
        filter in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        filter in interface FilterableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Specified by:
        filter in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        filter in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable to be filtered out
        state - the state to be selected
        Returns:
        if we are in log-space, a BayesianLogFactor else a BayesianDefaultFactor

      • combine

        public BayesianFunctionFactor combine​(BayesianFactor other)
        Description copied from class: BayesianAbstractFactor

        This generic implementation checks if GenericFactor.isLog() the current factor and also the given one. If both are false, then a SimpleBayesianOperation algebra will be used and a BayesianDefaultFactor will be produced; otherwise a LogBayesianOperation algebra will be used, the second factor will be converted to a BayesianLogFactor (if needed) and a BayesianLogFactor will be returned.

        The BayesianOperation.combine(BayesianFactor, int, BayesianFactor, int) method will be used.

        Specified by:
        combine in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        combine in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        combine in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        other - the other factor to combine with
        Returns:
        a BayesianLogFactor if this factor works in log-space, otherwise a BayesianDefaultFactor

      • marginalize

        public BayesianFunctionFactor marginalize​(int variable)
        Description copied from class: BayesianAbstractFactor

        Marginalize a variable out of the factor. This corresponds to sum all parameters that differ only in the state of the marginalized variable.

        If this factor represent a Conditional Probability Table you should only marginalize variables on the right side of the conditioning bar. If so, there is no need for further normalization.

        This default implementation checks if this factor GenericFactor.isLog() then if true, uses a LogBayesianMarginal as BayesianCollector and produces a BayesianLogFactor, otherwise it uses a SimpleBayesianMarginal and produces a BayesianDefaultFactor.

        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        marginalize in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable to be summed out of the CPT
        Returns:
        if we are in log-space, a new BayesianLogFactor, else a new BayesianDefaultFactor, both with the variable marginalized out.

      • divide

        public BayesianFunctionFactor divide​(BayesianFactor factor)
        Description copied from class: BayesianAbstractFactor

        This generic implementation checks if GenericFactor.isLog() the current factor and also the given one. If both are false, then a SimpleBayesianOperation algebra will be used and a BayesianDefaultFactor will be produced; otherwise a LogBayesianOperation algebra will be used, the second factor will be converted to a BayesianLogFactor (if needed) and a BayesianLogFactor will be returned.

        The BayesianOperation.divide(BayesianFactor, int, BayesianFactor, int) method will be used.

        Specified by:
        divide in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        divide in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        divide in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - the other factor to combine with
        Returns:
        a BayesianLogFactor if this factor works in log-space, otherwise a BayesianDefaultFactor
